frame.name: Network
frame.definition:
<def-root>A set of entities of the same or similar types (<fen>Nodes</fen>) are linked to each other by <fen>Connections</fen> to form a <fen>Network</fen> allowing for the flow of information, resources, etc.
<ex>For the most part, <fex name="net">the Interstate System</fex> <m>is</m> a <fex name="des">connected</fex> <t>network</t> <fex name="Connections">of highways</fex> bounded by the Canadian and Mexican borders, the Gulf of Mexico, and the Atlantic.</ex>
<ex>Through <fex name="pos">our</fex> <fex name="des">worldwide</fex> <fex name="net"><t>network</t></fex> <fex name="Nodes">of representatives and agents</fex>, Lozenger Inc. was able to serve customers in countries around the globe.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Network
FE.definition:
<def-root>The system functioning as a unit that is constituted by the <fen>Nodes</fen> and <fen>Connections</fen>.
<ex>Efforts are underway to improve the road <fex name="net"><t>network</t></fex> in the state.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Nodes
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entities that are connected into a <fen>Network</fen>.
<ex>The National <t>Network</t> <fex name="nod">of Libraries of Medicine</fex> is dedicated to making the world's biomedical information available throughout the US.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Connections
FE.definition:
<def-root>The relationships or physical entities that connect the <fen>Nodes</fen>.
<ex>Every computer has its own cable to be connected straight to the server or by the <t>network</t> <fex name="con">of cables and T-connectors</fex>. </ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any characterization or evaluation of the <fen>Network</fen>.
<ex>But its ability to deliver these programs was severely compromised by its <fex name="des">outdated</fex> computer <t>network</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Possessor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person or organization that possesses or owns the <fen>Network</fen> or a larger entity of which the <fen>Network</fen> itself is a part.
<ex>This file-swapping activity on <fex name="pos">a company's</fex> computer <t>network</t> exposes a company to legal risk.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: network.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a system of entites of the same type interconnected for the purpose of exchange

lexUnit.name: web.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a complex system of interconnected elements.
